description.p: Moves the focus to the next cell within the same column or row in the respective directions.
If focus is on first row, the focus moves to the column header row.
If focus is on a cell of the first row, the focus moves to the related column header.
If focus is on Select All or Clear All checkbox, the focus moves to the row selector in the first visible row.
If focus is on column header row, the focus moves to the first row.
If focus is on row, the focus moves to the row below.
If focus is on cell, the focus moves to the cell below.
If focus is on first cell, the focus moves to the row. This switches from cell-based navigation to row-based navigation.
If focus is on cell, the focus moves to the cell to the left.
If focus is on row, the focus moves to the first cell of the currently focused row. This switches from row-based navigation to cell-based navigation.
If focus is on cell, the focus moves to the cell to the right.
Note: If focus is on last column, and the pop-in behavior has been enabled for this column, the pop-in area is treated like an additional column to the right, and the focus moves to this column.
If focus is on row, the focus moves to the column header row.
If focus is on column header row, and the More button is available, the focus moves to the More button.
If focus is on column header row, and the More button is not available, the focus moves to the last focused row.
If focus is on More button, the focus moves to the last focused row.
If focus is on row, and the More button is available, the focus moves to the More button.
If focus is on row, and the More button is not available, the focus moves to the column header row.
If focus is on More button, the focus moves to the column header row.
If focus is on column header row, the focus moves to the last focused row.
If focus is on column header, the width of this column is increased by 1 em. This is repeated if key remains pressed.
If focus is on a cell that is not selected, the focused cell and the cell to the right are selected. The focus moves to the cell to the right of the focused cell.
If focus is on a selected cell, the cell to the right gets the focus, and the cell selection is enhanced up to this cell.
If focus is on column header, the width of this column is decreased by 1 em. This is repeated if key remains pressed.
If focus is on a cell that is not selected, the focused cell and the cell to the left are selected. The focus moves to the cell to the left of the focused cell.
If focus is on a selected cell, the cell to the left gets the focus, and the cell selection is enhanced up to this cell.
If focus is on cell or row selector and the relevant row is selected, the focus moves to the row above, and the selection is enhanced up to this row.
If focus is on cell or row selector and the relevant row is not selected, the focus moves to the row above, and the selection is removed for this row.
If focus is on a cell that is not selected and the row is notselected, the focused cell and the cell above are selected. The focus moves to the cell above the focused cell.
If focus is on a selected cell, the focus moves to the cell above, and the cell selection is enhanced up to this cell.
If focus is on cell or row selector and the relevant row is selected, the focus moves to the row below, and the selection is enhanced up to this row.
If focus is on cell or row selector and the relevant row is not selected, the focus moves to the row below, and the selection is removed for this row.
If focus is on a cell that is not selected and the row is not selected, the focused cell and the cell below are selected. The focus moves to the cell below the focused cell.
If focus is on a selected cell, the focus moves to the cell below, and the cell selection is enhanced up to this cell.
If focus is on editable cell (for example, an input field), the focus moves to the cell above.
If focus is on editable cell (for example, an input field), the focus moves to the cell below.
If focus is on a cell, the focused cell is selected.
If focus is on a cell selection block, the selection of the cells is removed.
If focus is on a cell selection block, the cell selection block is changed into a row selection. The cell selection is removed.
Depending on the row selection mode the following happens:

ul.li: All rows of the block are selected (multiple selection)
Only the row with the currently focused cell is selected (single selection)
None of the rows are selected

description.p: If focus is inside of the table, the selection for any rows and cells is removed.
If focus is inside of the table and cells are selected, the selection of the cells is removed.
Toggles the focus between the cell and its content if the cell has interactive elements, such as an input field or button (with the exception of read-only text).
If focus is within a cell in edit mode, the focus moves to the row.
If cell selection is enabled:
If cells are selected, Shift + click on a different cell enhances the selection up to the clicked cell.
Copies the selected rows or cells to the clipboard, if available and the feature is enabled.
Pastes the content from the clipboard, if the feature is enabled.
Opens the variant management.
Closes the error popover of the variant management
Moves the item one position up, if available.
Moves the item one position down, if available.
Moves the item to the top, if available.
Moves the item to the end, if available.
Moves the item one position up, if available.
Moves the item one position down, if available.
Moves the item one position up, if available.
Moves the item one position down, if available.
